body_content.explanation: the colour of slate (= a dark grey rock that can be easily divided into thin pieces):
examples: They walked through the slaty darkness beneath the palm trees.
He now looked across at her with his slaty dark eyes.
The sky was dark, and the sea was a slatier kind of grey, with white horses dancing on the waves.
The wolf looked at me with a cold expression in its slatey little eyes.
This hill is covered with a reddish slaty stone.
In some places the river bed was crossed by slaty reefs.
The rocks were slatey and treacherous, breaking away in thick flakes under our feet.
